(Simplified: 鸵)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 它 indicates the sound; 鳥 (bird) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 鳥 [ niǎo ] bird
    • 它 [ tā ] it; other
①(鴕鳥)現代鳥類中最大的鳥，高兩米多，生活在非洲的草原和沙漠地帶。肉和卵可食，羽毛可做裝飾品。
鴕鳥 [ tuó niǎo ]: ostrich
鴕鳥政策 [ tuó niǎo zhèng cè ]: ostrich policy (sticking one's head in the sand, failing to acknowledge danger)

“鸵1”的繁体字。
见“鴕鳥”。

鴕字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【鳥字部】　鴕； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1485第12
【集韻】唐何切，音駝。鴕鳥似雉。【晉書·張華傳】武庫封閉甚密，其中忽有雉雊。華曰：此必蛇化爲雉也。開視雉側，果有蛇蛻焉。又【前漢·西域傳】安息國有大馬爵。【師古註】《廣志》云：大爵，頸及膺身，蹄似橐駝，色蒼，舉頭高八九尺，張翅丈餘，食大麥。○按大馬爵似橐駝。本作駝，後人以鳥之名，攺馬從鳥。《張華傳》所云蛇化雉者，本作蛇，因其化雉，亦攺虫从鳥耳。

ostrich
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Collection] [Birds Department] 　亞; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 1485 No. 12
[Jiyun] Tang Heqie, sound camel. The ostrich resembles a pheasant. [Book of Jin·Zhang Hua Biography] The arsenal is very tightly closed, and there is a pheasant among them. Hua said: This must be a snake turned into a pheasant. Look at the side of the pheasant, and indeed there is a snake sloughing off. Also [Previous Han · Western Regions Biography] Anxi state-owned Da Ma Jue. [Shigu's Note] "Guangzhi" says: Dajue, neck and body, hoof like a camel, color gray, raised his head eight or nine feet high, spread his wings and eat barley. ○According to Da Ma Jue, it is like a camel. This is a camel, and later generations use the name of a bird to draw a horse from a bird. The "Zhang Hua Biography" mentioned that the snake turns into a pheasant. This is a snake, because it turns into a pheasant, it also catches the worm from the bird's ears.
